item.title: over the hill adds PS5, Xbox Series, and Switch 2 versions
item.content:encoded:
• PS5
  • Switch 2
  • Xbox Series

Due out after the PC version.

Off-road exploration game over the hill will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and Switch 2 following its launch for PC via Steam in 2026, developers Funselektor and Strelka Games announced. Wishlisting is available now via PlayStation Store and Microsoft Store, with pre-orders via Nintendo eShop coming soon. The game ha also surpassed 600,000 wishlists on Steam.

Physical editions of over the hill will also be available for PlayStation 5 and Switch 2 via distributor Serenity Forge. Here are the details:

Standard Edition

  • PlayStation 5 or Switch 2 physical game
  • Window cling decoration
  • Original digital soundtrack

Collector’s Edition

  • PlayStation 5 or Switch 2 physical game
  • Window cling decoration
  • Rocking Dashboard Car Standee
  • Embroidered Patch
  • Lanyard Keychain
  • Winched Collar Pin
  • Vehicle Poster

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Explore, navigate, and uncover the vast wilderness in over the hill, the newest installation from the creator of art of rally. Ramble your way through varied biomes inspired by real-world locations, from valleys to mountains and everything in between.

Key Features

  • A World of Discovery – Discover portals to travel to new areas, and complete objectives to unlock new vehicles, upgrades, customizations, and cosmetics, with many combinations to try. Who knows, maybe you’ll find some hidden gems along the way.
  • Multi or Single Player – Take a friend or go on a solo tour. Challenge yourself, collaborate with up to three friends, or just enjoy the sights – the world is your oyster.
  • Pitch Up – Fancy a break? Why not plan your next excursion with your friends?! Set up a campsite for some much-needed R&R after a long day in the elements. Gather your friends around the campfire, grab a hot cocoa, and catch up on the day’s events.
  • Adapt and Overcome – Take on the elements with dynamic weather, day/night cycles, and realistic terrain deformation. Find solace in nature, even when you’re stuck in the mud.
  • It’s About the Journey – The best stories never start at the end. With so much to explore and uncover, it’s all about the cruise. Complete all the objectives, unlock the many customizations and upgrades, and discover everything the wilderness has to offer. Just take your time and find peace in the minimalistic serenity.
  • Capture the Beauty – Grab stills of your favorite landscapes with the built-in photo mode. We can’t wait to follow your journey. You never know what you may discover just over the hill.

Watch a new trailer below.

Consoles Announce Trailer

item.title: Free-to-play dark fantasy action RPG UnGodly announced for PS5, Xbox Series, PC, iOS, and Android
item.content:encoded:
Azra Games has announced UnGodly, a free-to-play dark fantasy character-collector action RPG. It will launch for iOS and Android in Q1 2026, followed by PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam and Epic Games Store later in 2026.

Here is an overview of the game, via Azra Games:

UnGodly is a dark fantasy, free-to-play character-collector RPG.

Designed for cross-platform play, UnGodly invites players into a world of visceral combat and emotionally charged storytelling, no matter where they play. Featuring a groundbreaking Affinity System and next-gen RPG mechanics, the game delivers cinematic depth and visceral intensity across mobile, console, and PC.

UnGodly, inspired by the savage worlds of forgotten sword and sorcery, invites players to step into a shattered realm where a mysterious force has driven civilization to ruin. Featuring visceral combat and evocative themes, the game rewards mastery with raw, brutal fights and real-time strategic gameplay.

Scarred by trauma yet undeniably striking, UnGodly‘s characters are as formidable as the world that seeks to break them. The game’s innovative “Affinity System” allows players to build emotional connections between characters, unlocking raw, vulnerability-driven narratives and intense dialog.

Azra Games, founded by veteran game designer Mark Otero, renowned for his 0-to-1 work on Electronic Arts‘ top-grossing Star Wars: Galaxy of Heroes (his eighth character-collector RPG), is supported by a skilled team of seasoned gaming experts. UnGodly, Azra Games’ debut “4th generation RPG,” aims to bring the dark fantasy genre into the modern age by seamlessly blending mobile and PC-quality experiences.

“UnGodly isn’t just a game; it’s a story about survival, struggle, and the indomitable human spirit, and it’s designed to speak to the primal instincts we all share,” said Azra Games founder and CEO Mark Otero in a press release. “We’ve created a world that is raw and honest, and will feel authentic to players who will recognize themselves in the characters. UnGodly is ambitious. We aim to shock and awe gamers with an unapologetically classic dark fantasy experience inspired by the Roleplaying games that many of us grew up with.”

Otero continued, “We are pioneering the 4th generation of mobile RPGs, bridging the gap between mobile and console / PC experiences. UnGodly will deliver open worlds, real-time party-based battles, and extended [player-versus-environment] campaigns, redefining mobile gaming with console-quality experiences. With a growing expert team and solid funding, we’re excited to bring western gamers unparalleled gameplay on both mobile and PC.”

Watch the announcement trailer below.

item.title: Milano’’s Odd Job Collection adds Switch 2 and Xbox One versions, launches December 9
item.content:encoded:
Milano’s Odd Job Collection will launch for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam, GOG, and Microsoft Store on December 9 for $14.99, publisher XSEED and developer Implicit Conversions announced. The Switch 2, Xbox One, and non-Steam PC versions are newly announced. The Switch 2 version will be available via a free Upgrade Pack for the Switch version.

About

This first western release of the Japanese classic expands upon the original pixel-art game with quality-of-life improvements including support for modern resolutions, trophies and achievements, fully localized English text with dual Japanese and English audio options, save states, a rewind feature and more.

School’s out, but 11-year-old Milano’s mom needs to go to the hospital and Milano is sent to spend the summer with her uncle. There’s one small problem—her uncle is away on vacation! Left on her own, Milano decides to make the most of her situation by taking up a variety of part-time jobs in town. Over the next 40 days, Milano goes all in—delivering pizzas, nursing sick patients, milking flying cows, and more—to make this summer unforgettable. And maybe she can spruce up her uncle’s place and have some fun while she’s at it. Highly replayable and featuring charming characters and gameplay that retro and casual game lovers of all skill levels can enjoy, this recently uncovered and updated gem of the 32-bit era isn’t to be missed!

Key Features

  • Milano Meets the World – Full English text and voiceovers bring Milano’s pixel-art adventures to a whole new audience. Fans can rest assured that the original Japanese is also available, complete with all-new English subtitles.
  • Make Your Home Away from Home – Rest and relaxation are important for work-life balance. Milano can style the house with new furniture and decor instead of going into work, and at night she can enjoy quiet time inside with her uncle’s cat, stargazing from her bedroom, and making use of items purchased with her hard-earned wages.
  • It’s Not Work if You Love to Do It – Help Milano earn money in eight unique mini-games, including curing diseases as a nurse, catching falling fruits in an orchard, and more. Enrich Milano’s skill, mood, and energy in the evenings to unlock more odd jobs and higher difficulty levels. The tougher the challenge, the bigger the payday!
  • Nostalgic Gameplay, Modern Conveniences – The charm and gameplay of the original release are intact, but improved load times, save states, and a rewind feature help update this classic title for modern audiences.

View a new set of screenshots at the gallery.

item.title: Aphelion ‘Hide to Survive’ trailer
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

Sci-fi third-person action adventure game due out in 2026.

DON’T NOD has released a new trailer for cinematic science-fiction third-person action adventure game Aphelion, dubbed “Hide to Survive.”

Here is an overview of the game, via DON’T NOD:

About

Stranded on a frozen planet, astronaut Ariane must brave rugged landscapes and shifting realities to rescue her wounded partner, Thomas. This action-packed science-fiction adventure blends exploration, traversal, and tense stealth gameplay.

A Science-Fiction Action Adventure on the Edge of Our Solar System

By 2060, Earth will be uninhabitable. The discovery of a ninth planet—Persephone—at the edge of the solar system, is humanity’s best hope. The European Space Agency is dispatching the Hope 01 scientific mission, consisting of two of their accomplished astronauts, Ariane and Thomas. Their mission: to survey the planet and determine whether humanity can prosper anew here.

Your adventure begins in chaos, as the crash landing of their ship scatters them across the planet, launching them on a desperate quest to find one another.

Aphelion is a cinematic third-person action-adventure set on the planet Persephone, an uncharted, frozen world. Stranded and isolated, you must survive the truly unknown, find each other, and complete the mission. Traverse stunning alien landscapes, avoid lurking threats, and discover the haunting secrets buried beneath the ice.

Explore an Uncharted Planet

Explore the surreal beauty of Persephone, a vast frozen world shaped by deadly weather and ever-changing terrain.

Armed only with your explorational tools—pathfinder, oxygen tank, grappling hook, and more—you must face the unknown, traverse treacherous terrain, and gather clues about the strange, reality-bending phenomenon threatening your existence.

Find Each Other

Helpless on the edge of the solar system, the Hope 01 crew faces a brutal new world and the echoes of a complicated past. Ariane Montclair and Thomas Cross share a deep connection, a relationship left unresolved by the demands of their careers and their mission. Facing overwhelming odds, their fractured bond becomes a lifeline as they grasp in the dark for one another.

Hide to Survive

You’re not alone. Something lurks beneath the ice.

Key Features

  • A realistic depiction of space exploration.
  • An emotional drama on an alien world.
  • Cinematic action-adventure with gripping traversal gameplay.
  • Tools-based exploration and survival.
  • Tense and exciting stealth-based sequences.

Aphelion is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam and Microsoft Store in 2026. It will also be available via Game Pass.

Watch the trailer below.

item.title: Darkwood II announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
• PC

Also available via Game Pass.

Publisher Hooded Horse and developer Ice-Pick Lodge have announced survival horror game sequel Darkwood II for PC (Steam, Microsoft Store). A release date was not announced. It will also be available via Game Pass.

Here is an overview of the game, via Hooded Horse:

Set merely a few years after the events of the critically acclaimed survival horror game Darkwood, the sequel brings with it new lands and waters to explore, new creatures to fear, and new reasons to pray for the morning light. Featuring an entirely new story and new characters, the unfolding events of Darkwood II stand on their own, and can be equally enjoyed regardless of whether you’ve played the first game in the series.

In the aftermath of the Soviet Union’s collapse, the dying Aral Sea has become the site of an anomaly—an eerie forest that swallows everything in its path. No one knows where it came from, or why—retribution, perhaps, for humanity’s abuse of nature.

All around lie the ruins of a vanished world—deserted villages, rusting ships marooned in sand, derelict oil rigs, power stations, and factories on the verge of collapse. A secret biological lab sits in silence on a remote island as roving gangs of looters, bikers, and former soldiers control the remaining population through fear. Nomads travel through these lands with no rest or respite, day or night—even walls can’t guarantee safety.

As the world loses its humanity, and as the so-called corruption of the forest spreads, one can’t help but wonder—is it really better to remain human? Or would it be best to give in?

Only the heart of the forest holds the answer.

Darkwood II sends you on dangerous meandering paths across barren deserts, through thick marsh, and on deep waters alike. As the locals fight to keep the slowly spreading woods at bay, you must rely on your wits to overcome your fears and find your way—there are no quest markers or waypoints to guide you.

Scavenge for resources, craft weapons to protect yourself, and seek out shelter by night, building barricades and traps to hide behind, securing yourself against an enemy that can strike from any direction. Will you cower in a cellar as the doors creak open and close a few floors above you, or will you stand against the horrors that stalk the night? Or perhaps you’ll choose to rely on strange concoctions to gain new skills and capabilities that may just keep you alive—in a manner of speaking.

Meet twisted characters, each with their own motivations—learn their dark backstories and make decisions that will determine their fates and impact the world itself, changing your story as you move through it.

item.title: Survival horror game AGNI: Village of Calamity adds Xbox Series version
item.content:encoded:
• Xbox Series

Due out in 2026.

Survival horror game AGNI: Village of Calamity, from Indonesian studio Separuh Interactive, will launch for Xbox Series alongside its previously announced PC (Steam) version in 2026, the developer announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via Separuh Interactive:

About

Embark on a chilling psychological horror journey through an eerie Javanese village, steeped in Indonesian culture. Navigate surreal, nightmarish exploration and mind-bending puzzles, all while being hunted by an unkillable entity. The story delves into trauma, choices, and letting go, offering a deeply personal, culturally immersive experience. With a Lynchian narrative style, it blurs reality and forces you to confront inner demons. Your choices manifest as terrifying personal consequences, keeping you questioning what’s real long after the game ends.

As Investigator, inspect all necessary clues to solve mysteries throughout your journey.

As Investigator, you would need to understand your surrounding, inspect necessary scenes to understand the context through our inspection mechanic. Also, you could inspect the item inside your inventory to get hidden clues that lies beneath.

Key Features

Step into a world where horror meets strategy, and every moment is a test of your wits and nerves. AGNI: Village of Calamity delivers a gripping survival horror experience like no other, with unique features that will keep you on the edge of your seat.

  • Short, Intense Playtime with Immersive Storytelling – Dive into a rich, cinematic narrative packed with unforgettable moments. With interactive set pieces and a plot that hooks you from the start, each playthrough offers a new, chilling adventure.
  • Brutal Combat with a Twist – Channel your inner slasher fan with a combat system that’s as fierce as it is satisfying. Inspired by the raw intensity of classic Indonesian horror slasher films, AGNI: Village of Calamity takes gore to the next level, making every fight feel impactful and visceral.
  • Classic Survival Horror Vibes – Survive the night with limited resources and nail-biting decisions. The game blends linear progression with strategic resource management, challenging you to use every tool and item wisely. Backtracking becomes a chilling necessity as you unravel the mysteries hidden in the shadows.
  • A Nod to Horror Legends – With its fixed hybrid camera and relentless stalker enemies, AGNI: Village of Calamity honors the greats of survival horror like Resident Evil and Silent Hill. The tension builds as you’re stalked by menacing foes, reminding you that escape is never easy—and safety is never guaranteed

Watch a new trailer below.
